xml.spreadsheet.style

Class Alignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • xml.spreadsheet.style.Alignment

  • public class Alignment
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the font alignment attributes to use in this style. Each attribute that is specified is considered an override from the default.
    See Also:
    MSDN Alignment element reference

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • setHorizontal

        public void setHorizontal(Alignment.HorizontalAlignment horizontal)
        Parameters:
        horizontal - Specifies the left-to-right alignment of text within a cell

      • setRotate

        public void setRotate(double rotate)
        Parameters:
        rotate - Specifies the rotation of the text within the cell. 90 is straight up, 0 is horizontal, and -90 is straight down

      • setShrinkToFit

        public void setShrinkToFit(boolean shrinkToFit)
        Parameters:
        shrinkToFit - True means that the text size should be shrunk so that all of the text fits within the cell. False means that the font within the cell should behave normally

      • setVertical

        public void setVertical(Alignment.VerticalAlignment vertical)
        Parameters:
        vertical - Specifies the top-to-bottom alignment of text within a cell. Distributed and JustifyDistributed are only legitimate values when ss:VerticalText is True

      • setVerticalText

        public void setVerticalText(boolean verticalText)
        Parameters:
        verticalText - Specifies whether the text is drawn "downwards", whereby each letter is drawn horizontally, one above the other

      • setWrapText

        public void setWrapText(boolean wrapText)
        Parameters:
        wrapText - Specifies whether the text in this cell should wrap at the cell boundary. False means that text either spills or gets truncated at the cell boundary (depending on whether the adjacent cell(s) have content)
